title: Remove widget Settings action and standardize dates to DD/MM/YY

requirements.summary: Remove the Settings action/button that opens the widget view so users can’t launch the widget from Settings.
acceptanceCriteria: Settings page no longer renders the button labeled “Open Widget View” (or any equivalent open-widget button).
The unused click handler (e.g., `handleOpenWidget`) and related imports (e.g., ExternalLink icon) are removed if no longer needed.
No navigation route or page is required to be deleted; only the Settings open-widget entry point is removed.

file_operations.description: Remove the Settings UI button that opens the widget view, delete `handleOpenWidget`, and drop any now-unused imports (e.g., `ExternalLink`). Keep the WidgetView route/page intact per requirement.

requirements.summary: Standardize all user-visible date display to DD/MM/YY while keeping 12-hour time (AM/PM) for date+time strings.
acceptanceCriteria: Any UI that shows a date (e.g., appointment-related messages, Settings “Last Synced”, exports’ date columns) displays the date portion in DD/MM/YY format.
Places currently using US locale date formatting (e.g., `toLocaleString('en-US'...)`, `toLocaleDateString('en-US'...)`) are updated so the resulting output is DD/MM/YY.

Places currently using date-fns formats for dates (e.g., `format(date, 'MMM dd, yyyy')` / `format(date, 'MMM dd')`) are updated so displayed dates follow DD/MM/YY (2-digit day, 2-digit month, 2-digit year).
No user-facing text is changed except as required by the new date format.

file_operations.description: Update/extend the app’s shared date formatting helpers so date-only strings render as DD/MM/YY and date+time strings render as DD/MM/YY with 12-hour time and AM/PM. Ensure existing callers (e.g., Settings last synced, exports) can use these helpers without changing non-date text.

Replace date-fns display formats like `MMM dd, yyyy` / `MMM dd` with the standardized DD/MM/YY formatting for any on-screen appointment date strings and any user-visible message strings that include dates (e.g., WhatsApp reminder text).
Replace date-fns display formats like `MMM dd, yyyy` for follow-up and expected dates with DD/MM/YY formatting.

Update Settings date formatting to use the standardized DD/MM/YY helpers everywhere dates are shown/exported, including: the “Last Synced” display and all export-related date serialization (CSV date columns and any exported date strings). Also replace any `toLocaleDateString('en-US', ...)` usage so output is DD/MM/YY.
